title: Roman Numerals

# Roman Numerals: The Complete Guide (Fixed)

## 1. The Concept (ELI7)
Long ago in Rome, people used **Letters** to count, like using coins.
You simply put coins next to each other and add them up (I + I = II).

**THE TWO GOLDEN RULES (Read this!):**

1. **The Rule of 3 (The Limit):** You can NEVER, ever put more than **3** of the same letter in a row.
 * **IIII** is Forbidden! ❌
 * **XXXX** is Forbidden! ❌
 * **CCCC** is Forbidden! ❌
 * *Exception:* The letter **M** (1000) can technically be repeated more (MMMM), but usually Romans stopped there.
 * *Note:* The letters **V, L, D** (The "5s") are **NEVER** repeated. You can't say VV (5+5), you just say X (10).

2. **The Subtraction Fix:** Because we can't write "IIII" for 4, we write "5 minus 1".
 * We put the small letter **behind** the big letter.
 * **IV** (One before Five) = 4.

---

## 2. The 7 Magic Letters (MEMORIZE THESE)

| Letter | Value | Meaning |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **I** | **1** | A single finger |
| **V** | **5** | A hand shape (V) |
| **X** | **10** | Two hands crossed |
| **L** | **50** | Half of C |
| **C** | **100** | **C**entury (100 years) |
| **D** | **500** | Half of M |
| **M** | **1000** | **M**illennium (1000 years) |

---

## 3. The "Subtraction" List (The Fixers)
This happens when you hit the "Limit of 3". You must switch to subtraction.

| Symbol | Math | Value |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **IV** | 5 - 1 | **4** |
| **IX** | 10 - 1 | **9** |
| **XL** | 50 - 10 | **40** |
| **XC** | 100 - 10 | **90** |
| **CD** | 500 - 100 | **400** |
| **CM** | 1000 - 100 | **900** |

---

## 4. Reference Tables (EXHAUSTIVE)

### The Units (1-9)
| Number | Roman | Why? |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | **I** | Just one |
| 2 | **II** | 1 + 1 |
| 3 | **III** | 1 + 1 + 1 (The Limit!) |
| 4 | **IV** | **STOP!** Can't do IIII. Do 5-1. |
| 5 | **V** | Five |
| 6 | **VI** | 5 + 1 |
| 7 | **VII** | 5 + 2 |
| 8 | **VIII** | 5 + 3 (The Limit!) |
| 9 | **IX** | **STOP!** Can't do VIIII. Do 10-1. |

### The Tens (10-90)
| Number | Roman | Why? |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 10 | **X** | Ten |
| 20 | **XX** | 10 + 10 |
| 30 | **XXX** | 10 + 10 + 10 (The Limit!) |
| 40 | **XL** | **STOP!** Can't do XXXX. Do 50-10. |
| 50 | **L** | Fifty |
| 60 | **LX** | 50 + 10 |
| 70 | **LXX** | 50 + 20 |
| 80 | **LXXX** | 50 + 30 (The Limit!) |
| 90 | **XC** | **STOP!** Can't do LXXXX. Do 100-10. |

### The Hundreds (100-900)
| Number | Roman | Why? |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 100 | **C** | Century |
| 200 | **CC** | 2 Centuries |
| 300 | **CCC** | 3 Centuries (The Limit!) |
| 400 | **CD** | **STOP!** Can't do CCCC. Do 500-100. |
| 500 | **D** | Five Hundred |
| 600 | **DC** | 500 + 100 |
| 700 | **DCC** | 500 + 200 |
| 800 | **DCCC** | 500 + 300 (The Limit!) |
| 900 | **CM** | **STOP!** Can't do DCCCC. Do 1000-100. |
| 1000 | **M** | Millennium |

---

## 5. Native Mnemonics (English)

### The Sentence Trick
To remember the order (M, D, C, L, X, V, I):
**"My Dear Cat Loves Xtra Vitamins Intensely"**

### The Rule of 3 Trick
"Three's a crowd, four is forbidden!"
